DataElement.preferredName: Occlusal Surface Crack Visible Staining Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to if the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth with a break or fissure in the structure, has perceptible, especially by the eye, discoloration of patient tissue(s) produced by absorption of, or contact with, foreign matter, such as with medical dyes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth. A break or fissure in a structure. Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view. Discoloration of patient tissue(s) produced by absorption of, or contact with, foreign matter, such as with medical dyes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.:A break or fissure in a structure.

Concepts.definition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.
A break or fissure in a structure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view.:Discoloration of patient tissue(s) produced by absorption of, or contact with, foreign matter, such as with medical dyes.

Concepts.definition: Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view.
Discoloration of patient tissue(s) produced by absorption of, or contact with, foreign matter, such as with medical dyes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
